p: Often, there may be an intermediate host for the virus on the way to becoming a human disease. Bats are increasingly recognized as important hosts for a number of zoonoses that cause CNS infection ( e.g. lyssaviruses, henipaviruses, coronaviruses and filoviruses) ( Halpin et al., 2007). Disruption of the environment with changing agricultural practices has increased the likelihood that these viruses will be transmitted to humans. Recent outbreaks of neurologic disease in humans due to the pteropid bat viruses Hendra and Nipah illustrate this process.
